DOCNAME: CASE OF TALATTİN AKKOÇ v. TURKEY
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in PERSON .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( PERSON ) expropriated a plot of land belonging to the applicant . A committee of experts assessed the value of the plot of land and the relevant amount was paid to him on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant filed an action for compensation with ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the first - instance court ordered the administration to pay the applicant MONEY ( TRL ) plus interest at the statutory rate , running from DATE , the date on which the ownership of the property was transferred to the administration .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the decision of the first - instance court .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s request for the rectification of its decision .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG paid the applicant the amount due together with interest .

CARDINAL . NORP The relevant domestic law and practice are set out in the Aka v. GPE judgment of DATE ( Reports of Judgments and Decisions CARDINAL-VI , pp . DATE , § § DATE ) and PERSON v. GPE judgment of DATE ( Reports CARDINAL , § § CARDINAL ) .
